thread.title: The last LOL: Only older people still use 'laugh out loud' acronym, Facebook claims
thread.title_full: The last LOL: Only older people still use 'laugh out loud' acronym, Facebook claims - Mirror Online

author: Jasper Hamill
title: The last LOL: Only older people still use 'laugh out loud' acronym, Facebook claims
text:
The internet as thrown up all sorts of annoying phrases - but LOL is perhaps one of the most irritating.
Now Facebook research has shown the acronym for "laugh out loud" may be dying a long-awaited death.
The social network decided to analyse its users' conversations over the course of a week to see how often they "e-laughed" and which words they used during their cyber-sniggers.
People who used LOL tended to be the oldest, whilst younger people used emojis when something has tickled them.
In the middle of these two extremes are the folk who use "haha" and "hehe".
Men were more likely to use "hehe" than women, as well as "ha ha", whilst ladies seem to enjoy using tiny icons more than emojinally repressed men.
"As denizens of the Internet will know, laughter is quite common: 15% of people included laughter in a post or comment that week," the social media giant wrote.
But remember: he/she who lols last lols loudest.
